name: Machine Learning
privilegesTooltip: Granting All or Read feature privilege for Machine Learning will also grant the equivalent feature privileges to certain types of Kibana saved objects, namely index patterns, dashboards, saved searches and visualizations as well as machine learning job, trained model and module saved objects.

reserved.description: To grant users access, you should also assign either the machine_learning_user or machine_learning_admin role.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Endpoint List access.
subFeatures.name: Endpoint List
subFeatures.description: Displays all hosts running Elastic Defend and their relevant integration details.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Trusted Applications access.
subFeatures.name: Trusted Applications
subFeatures.description: Helps mitigate conflicts with other software, usually other antivirus or endpoint security applications.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Host Isolation Exceptions access.
subFeatures.name: Host Isolation Exceptions
subFeatures.description: Add specific IP addresses that isolated hosts are still allowed to communicate with, even when isolated from the rest of the network.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Blocklist access.
subFeatures.name: Blocklist
subFeatures.description: Extend Elastic Defends protection against malicious processes and protect against potentially harmful applications.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Event Filters access.
subFeatures.name: Event Filters
subFeatures.description: Filter out endpoint events that you do not need or want stored in Elasticsearch.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Policy Management access.
subFeatures.name: Elastic Defend Policy Management
subFeatures.description: Access the Elastic Defend integration policy to configure protections, event collection, and advanced policy features.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Response Actions History access.
subFeatures.name: Response Actions History
subFeatures.description: Access the history of response actions performed on endpoints.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Host Isolation access.
subFeatures.name: Host Isolation

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Process Operations access.
subFeatures.name: Process Operations
subFeatures.description: Perform process-related response actions in the response console.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for File Operations access.
subFeatures.name: File Operations
subFeatures.description: Perform file-related response actions in the response console.

subFeatures.privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Execute Operations access.
subFeatures.name: Execute Operations
subFeatures.description: Perform script execution response actions in the response console.

subFeatures.name: Field Selection and Anonymization
subFeatures.description: Change the default fields that are allowed to be used by the AI Assistant and Attack discovery. Anonymize any of the content for the selected fields.

name: Dev Tools
privilegesTooltip: User should also be granted the appropriate Elasticsearch cluster and index privileges

name: Shared images
privilegesTooltip: Required to access images stored in Kibana.

name: Saved Query Management
privilegesTooltip: If set to "All", saved queries can be managed across Kibana in all applications that support them. If set to "None", saved query privileges will be determined independently by each application.

name: Fleet
privilegesTooltip: All Spaces is required for Fleet access.

reserved.description: Privilege to setup Fleet packages and configured policies. Intended for use by the elastic/fleet-server service account only.
To grant users access, you should also assign the monitoring_user role.
